chapter.title: Setting Up a &branchserv;
chapter.para: The &branchserv; provides the network boot and system management infrastructure for the &sleposreg; terminals and a generic system platform for instore applications, such as database systems and back-ends for the &pos; applications.

The &branchserv; can be installed in two modes, online or offline. The online installation mode requires an Internet connection to the &admserv;. If no Internet connection to the &admserv; is available, use the offline installation mode.
If you intend to set up a high-availability &branchserv;, check out the &haguide;, available from .

note.title: System Requirements
note.para: For a list of system requirements to set up an &branchserv;, refer to .

chapter.para: Before configuring a &branchserv;, check if the following conditions are met:

listitem.para: The &branchserv; pattern must be installed on the machine to be configured. If it is missing, install it. For more information about the &slepos; 11 installation, see .
The &admserv; and its LDAP database must be configured and initialized as described in . For more information about LDAP database configuration and initialization, see .

Either Internet connection to the &admserv; or the offline installation package must be available. If an Internet connection is available, follow the procedure described in . If the offline installation package is available, follow the procedure described in .

sect1.title: &branchserv; Network Configuration
sect1.para: &slepos; offers three ways to configure the network on a &branchserv;:

listitem.para: LDAP-based,
&branchserv;-based,
predefined defaults.

sect2.title: LDAP-Based Network Configuration
sect2.para: The &branchserv; network is configured based on the settings defined in LDAP. This mode is selected when all of the following conditions are met:

listitem.para: The &branchserv;'s object scLocation attributes ipNetworkNumber and ipNetworkMask differ from 0.0.0.0.
Either one scNetworkcard is defined under scLocation object or one NIC is left unconfigured on &branchserv;.
scNetworkcard attribute scDevice matches one of the &branchserv;'s NIC.
scNetworkcard attribute ipHostNumber differs from 0.0.0.0.

sect2.para: posInitBranchServer then automatically updates network configuration and basic DNS configuration. When posInitBranchServer is about to overwrite a manual configuration, user confirmation is requested. If it is running in noninteractive mode, permission to overwrite is granted automatically.

sect2.title: &branchserv;-Based Network Configuration
sect2.para: The &branchserv;'s NICs are manually configured on the &branchserv;. This mode is selected when all of the following conditions are met:

listitem.para: &branchserv;'s object scLocation attributes ipNetworkNumber and ipNetworkMask equal 0.0.0.0.

One scNetworkcard is defined under scLocation object and its scDevice attribute matches one of the manually configured NICs on the &branchserv;, or there is only one manually configured NIC on the &branchserv;, which matches one of scNetworkCards scDevice attributes.
scNetworkcard attribute ipHostNumber equals 0.0.0.0.

sect2.para: posInitBranchServer then updates the LDAP configuration to match the current BranchServer configuration and updates the basic DNS configuration.

sect2.title: Predefined Network Configuration
sect2.para: The &branchserv;'s NICs are configured according to the &slepos; defaults. This mode is selected when all of the following conditions are met:

listitem.para: &branchserv;'s object scLocation attributes ipNetworkNumber and ipNetworkMask equal 0.0.0.0.

One scNetworkcard is defined under scLocation object and its scDevice attribute matches one unconfigured NIC on the &branchserv;, or there is only one unconfigured NIC on the &branchserv;, which matches one of the scNetworkCards scDevice attributes.
scNetworkcard attribute ipHostNumber equals 0.0.0.0.

sect2.para: When no information about the network is set, posInitBranchServer configures NICs and updates LDAP databases with a configuration based on &slepos; defaults:
sect2.screen: scLocation attributes: scNetworkNumber = '192.168.1.0' scNetworkMask = '255.255.255.0' scDhcpRange = '192.168.1.10,192.168.1.54' scDhcpFixedRange = '192.168.1.55,192.168.1.88' scDefaultGw = '192.168.1.1' scNetworkcard attribute ipHostNumber = '192.168.1.1'

sect1.title: Configuring &branchserv; with the posInitBranchserver Command
sect1.para: The posInitBranchserver command is provided for the &branchserv; configuration.

sect2.title: Online &branchserv; Configuration

step.para: Execute the posInitBranchserver command.
The posInitBranchserver command asks for the installation mode to be used. For the default online installation enter 1 or press .

Provide the required information. Enter the organization/company name (organization), organizational unit (organizationalUnit) and location/branch name (scLocation) as initialized on the &admserv; (and as specified in the LDAP database). Enter the resolvable and connectible name or the IP address of the &admserv;. Enter the &branchserv; password defined when the scLocation object was created using posAdmin on the &admserv;.

It is possible to use nested organizational units, for example: cn=mybranch,ou=mysuborgunit,ou=myorgunit,o=myorg,c=us. To enter nested organizational units to posInitBranchserver, use the dot notation: mysuborgunit.myorgunit.

The script checks resolvability of the &admserv; IP address and tries to download &admserv; certificates. The certificates are then used for automatic establishment of encrypted SSL communication. If no certificates are found, an unencrypted communication is used.

important.title: &admserv;'s rsync Port Must Be Open
important.para: Make sure the rsync port (usually 873) is open on the &admserv;. The rsync port is not open in the default SLES11 installation. You need to add it by entering its number in the &yast; Firewall module under Allowed Services Advanced TCP Ports .

important.title: &branchserv;'s TFTP Port Must Be Open
important.para: Make sure the TFTP port (usually 69) is open on the &branchserv;. This port is not open in the default SLES11 installation. You need to add it by adding its number in the &yast; Firewall module under Allowed Services Advanced TCP Ports . If FTP is used, the FTP ports must be open.

step.para: If an &admserv; certificate is found, you are asked to acknowledge its fingerprint and validate it.

The script asks if you want to create and use a local branch LDAP database on the &branchserv;. It contains a copy of the subtree from the &admserv; LDAP database which corresponds to this &branchserv;. This is part of the &slepos; 11 offline functionality feature. The recommended default setting is yes.
If your choice is yes, the script initializes a local branch LDAP database. If your choice is no, enter the host name or IP address of an already initialized LDAP database.
The script issues a command to start LDAP SyncRelp replication to create a copy of the branch subtree from the &admserv;'s LDAP database.
If everything is in order, the script finds the &branchserv; domain in the &admserv;'s LDAP database and prints information about the found domain.
The script asks for a final confirmation before it configures and starts the core &branchserv; services.
If everything is in order, the script finishes successfully. If an error occurs, it is reported and logged in syslog.

note.title: Aborting the Command
note.para: If you select no in any configuration step (except when selecting not to use a local branch LDAP), the script deletes all its intermediate data and exits.

sect2.title: Offline &branchserv; Configuration

step.para: Preferably, execute posInitBranchserver -f pathToOfflineInstallationFile. You can also execute the posInitBranchserver command without options and select 2 when asked for the installation mode to be used.

Provide the required information. Enter the organization/company name (organization), organizational unit (organizationalUnit) and location/branch name (scLocation) as initialized on the &admserv; (and as specified in the LDAP database). Enter the resolvable and connectible name or the IP address of the &admserv;. Enter the &branchserv; password defined when the scLocation object was created using posAdmin on the &admserv;.
If an offline installation file was provided in the first step, the default values from the file are used.
In the offline installation mode, the script does not check resolvability of the &admserv; IP address. Server certificates are copied from the offline installation file, if present.

If an &admserv; certificate is found, you are asked to acknowledge its fingerprint and validate it. SSL communication is then automatically established. emap: even during offline installation? If no certificate is found, unencrypted communication is used.

The script asks if you want to create and use a local branch LDAP database on the &branchserv;. It contains a copy of the subtree from the &admserv; LDAP database which corresponds to this &branchserv;. This is a part of the &slepos; 11 offline functionality feature. The recommended default setting is yes.
If you select yes, the script initializes a local branch LDAP database. If you select no, enter the host name or IP address of an already-initialized LDAP database.
The script initializes the local branch LDAP database using the ldapadd command from the offline installation file.

In offline installation mode, it is not yet possible to find the &branchserv; domain. Therefore, if there is no Internet connection, the attempt fails and the script terminates. However if there is a connection to the &admserv;, the script finds the &branchserv; domain in the &admserv;'s LDAP database and prints information about the found domain.
The script asks for a final confirmation before it configures and starts the core &branchserv; services.
If everything is in order, the script finishes successfully. If an error occurs, it is reported and logged in syslog.

note.title: Aborting the Command
note.para: If you select no in any configuration step (except when you select not to use a local branch LDAP), the script deletes all its intermediate data and exits.

note.title: Administration and Branch Server Combination
note.para: If the Administration and Branch Servers are being configured on a single machine, no certificates are used and the SSL communication is disabled. Also, there is no local branch LDAP database created, as the offline functionality is not needed.

sect3.title: Transferring System Image Files
sect3.para: If there is no network connection between &admserv; and &branchserv;, the system image files must be copied from the &admserv; to the &branchserv; manually.

Boot images must be copied from the /srv/SLEPOS/boot/ directory on the &admserv; to the /srv/tftpboot/boot/ directory on the &branchserv; and then put to production using the possyncimages --local command.

System images and their associated MD5 checksum files must be copied from /srv/SLEPOS/image/ on the &admserv; to /srv/tftpboot/image on the &branchserv; and then put to production using the possyncimages --local command.

sect2.title: Changing the &branchserv; Password
sect2.para: Before attempting to change the &branchserv; password, ensure that the following conditions are met and understood:

listitem.para: The &branchserv; is already initialized.
The &branchserv; is in online mode and the &admserv;'s LDAP is available.
The &branchserv;'s local LDAP will be restarted during the procedure.

sect2.para: When you are ready to proceed with changing the password, call posInitBranchServer -p or posInitBranchServer --chpasswd.

You will be asked to enter the old &branchserv; password then the new &branchserv; password twice. After changing the password, the system will perform a password validation and inform you of the result.

sect1.title: Distributing Images to the &branchserv;
sect1.para: If you want to create a new image or change an image version, run the possyncimages command at the &branchserv;. This transfers new or updated images to the &branchserv; after the images have been added to the &admserv;’s RSYNC directory.

important.title: rsync Service and LDAP Objects
important.para: The rsync service must be properly configured and running on the &admserv; for the possynimages command to run. For more information, see .

Additionally, each system image has an associated scPosImage object in LDAP. The object's scPosImageVersion attribute should be set to active or a relevant scImageVersion object must be created to keep track of the most recent image version and state before possyncimages transfers the images to the &branchserv;. For more information, see .

sect1.para: The basic process is as follows:

step.para: Via the PID file, the possyncimages command initially checks if an instance is already running.

The image files are then copied from the &admserv; to the &branchserv;. Boot images are copied from the /srv/SLEPOS/boot/ directory on the &admserv; to the /srv/tftpboot/boot/ directory on the &branchserv;. System images and their associated MD5 checksum files are copied from /srv/SLEPOS/image/ to /srv/tftpboot/image.
possyncimages downloads the base images first but later prefers downloading the deltas instead of full images. Full images are re-created on the &branchserv; in /srv/SLEPOS.
During this process, the TFTP server must be stopped or otherwise prevented from transmitting the image files to clients.

sect2.title: Controlling the List of Images Downloaded by &branchserv;
sect2.para: The scLocation object can have a multivalue scSynchronizedImagesDn attribute, which contains a list of scPosImage or scCashRegister DNs. The possyncimages command downloads only the listed images or the images used on listed terminals. If one scPosImage object points to multiple image versions, the command downloads all active ones. An empty list means that all images have been downloaded. The list can be edited with posAdmin.

sect1.title: Starting the posleases2ldap Service
sect1.para: Start the posleases2ldap service on the &branchserv; using the systemctl start posleases2ldap.service command. The services is responsible for registering any new &pos; terminals at the LDAP directory and transferring image install notification data to the LDAP directory on the &admserv;.

sect1.title: Starting the posASWatch Service
sect1.para: The systemctl start posASWatch command checks if the &admserv; is available. It also checks the status of LDAP synchronization replication and the posleases2ldap core service. The service is started with the rcposASWatch start command and stopped with the rcposASWatch stop command. To check the service status, use the rcposASWatch status command.

important.title: Start the Service Manually
important.para: To ensure that local LDAP contains valid data (if the &branchserv; and &admserv; are installed on different machines), you need to start the service after the &branchserv; is restarted. The service is NOT configured to start automatically by default. If the service is not running and the network connection to the &admserv; is down, the &branchserv; cannot function properly.
To ensure that the &branchserv; starts the posASWatch command automatically at boot time, execute the insserv posASWatch command.

note.title: When the posASWatch Service is Not Required
note.para: The posASWatch service is needed when the network connection to the &admserv; is down. If the &admserv; is never used or the &admserv; and the &branchserv; are combined on one machine, this service is not required. When the machine hosting both servers is configured and an attempt to start the service is made, the service will exit with an error message.

sect1.title: Installing a &branchserv; Using a Specialized Image
sect1.para: Instead of installing &branchserv;s using the standard method (installing &sls; with the &slepos; add-on and manual configuration of the &branchserv;), it is possible to build a &branchserv; image using Image Creator or KIWI.

The image building process is the same as for terminal images. The image boot defaults to "oemboot" with the "install_stick" option. The result is a USB image, which offers installation to a hard disk during first boot. Other boot methods can be configured according to the KIWI manual.

The provided image is suitable for the online installation, where the terminal images and LDAP data are downloaded from the &admserv;. For offline installation, the terminal images and OIF files must be added to the &branchserv; image before building. The OIF files of one or more branches must be added to the /usr/share/SLEPOS/OIF of the image (/var/lib/SLEPOS/system/images/branchserver-3.4.0/root/usr/share/SLEPOS/OIF). You can also copy the terminal images from &admserv;'s /srv/SLEPOS to /var/lib/SLEPOS/system/images/branchserver-3.4.0/root/srv/SLEPOS.

When the &branchserv; image boots, it is necessary to configure one network interface card for connecting to the &admserv;, the other one can remain unconfigured. Then it offers offline installation based on the selected OIF file or online installation.

sect1.title: Installing a &branchserv; on the Host Running &susemanproxy;
sect1.para: It is possible to install a &branchserv; on the same machine running &susemanproxy;. To do this, deploy a &branchserv; by installing the &slepos; &branchserv; pattern first (see ). Install then &susemanproxy; as described in . Make sure that you do not install the susemanager-tftpsync-recv package.

warning.title: &susemanproxy; Boot Server
warning.para: Do not enable boot server of &susemanproxy;, as it conflics with the boot server of &slepos;.
